definition: in an easily perceptible manner, readily apparent to the mind, a clear or unobstructed space or expanse of land or water, to free the throat by making a rasping sound
details:
adverb
- in an easily perceptible manner
= example: in an easily perceptible manner
= synonyms: clearly
- completely
= example: completely
= synonyms: plumb
adjective
- readily apparent to the mind
= example: readily apparent to the mind
- allowing light to pass through
= example: allowing light to pass through
- free from confusion or doubt
= example: free from confusion or doubt
- free from clouds or mist or haze
= example: free from clouds or mist or haze
- accurately stated or described
= synonyms: well-defined
- characterized by ease and quickness in perceiving
= example: characterized by ease and quickness in perceiving
= synonyms: percipient
- clear and distinct to the senses
= synonyms: clear-cut, clean-cut
- (especially of a title) free from any encumbrance or limitation that presents a question of fact or law
= example: (especially of a title) free from any encumbrance or limitation that presents a question of fact or law
= synonyms: unmortgaged
- freed from any question of guilt
= synonyms: cleared, absolved, exculpated, exonerated, vindicated
- easily deciphered
= synonyms: decipherable, readable
- clear of charges or deductions
= example: clear of charges or deductions
- affording free passage or view
= example: affording free passage or view
= synonyms: open
- free from flaw or blemish or impurity
= example: free from flaw or blemish or impurity
- (of sound or color) free from anything that dulls or dims
= synonyms: clean, light, unclouded
- free of restrictions or qualifications
= synonyms: clean
- characterized by freedom from troubling thoughts (especially guilt)
= example: characterized by freedom from troubling thoughts (especially guilt)
- free from contact or proximity or connection
noun
- a clear or unobstructed space or expanse of land or water
= synonyms: open
- the state of being free of suspicion
= example: the state of being free of suspicion
verb
- to free the throat by making a rasping sound
= synonyms: clear up
- to rid of obstructions
= example: to rid of obstructions
= synonyms: unclutter
- to remove something
= example: to remove something
= synonyms: empty, doff
- to make a way or path by removing objects
- to remove the occupants of
= example: to remove the occupants of
- to remove people from a building
= example: to remove people from a building
- to rid of instructions or data
= example: to rid of instructions or data
- to make clear, bright, light, or translucent
= example: to make clear, bright, light, or translucent
- to make free from confusion or ambiguity
= example: to make free from confusion or ambiguity
= synonyms: straighten out, crystallise, crystallize, crystalise, crystalize, clear up, illuminate, enlighten, elucidate, shed light on, sort out
- to settle, as of a debt
= example: to settle, as of a debt
= synonyms: solve
- to grant authorization or clearance for
= synonyms: pass
- to pronounce not guilty of criminal charges
= example: to pronounce not guilty of criminal charges
= synonyms: discharge
- to pass an inspection or receive authorization
= example: to pass an inspection or receive authorization
- to pass by, over, or under without making contact
= example: to pass by, over, or under without making contact
= synonyms: top
- to go away or disappear
= example: to go away or disappear
- to sell or get rid of
= example: to sell or get rid of
= synonyms: deal
- to be debited and credited to the proper bank accounts
= example: to be debited and credited to the proper bank accounts
- to earn on some commercial or business transaction
= synonyms: make
- to make as a net profit
= example: to make as a net profit
= synonyms: sack
- to yield as a net profit
= synonyms: net
- to clear from impurities, blemishes, pollution, etc.
= example: to clear from impurities, blemishes, pollution, etc.
- to free from payment of customs duties, as of a shipment
- to go unchallenged
= synonyms: pass
- to become clear
= example: to become clear
= synonyms: clear up, light up
